message.content: Yes, the authors specify the training details in the experiments section, including data splits, hyperparameters, and how they were chosen. They mention the synthetic and real data they use, the network architecture, the parameters for the Bayesian approach, and how they compare their proposed algorithm, FedSOUL, with other personalized federated learning methods. Further, in the appendix section, they describe additional configurations and experiments to evaluate the impact of different parameters on the performance of FedSOUL.

Yes, the authors specify all the training details in the experiments section and the appendix of the paper. They provide details on synthetic and real data, experiment settings, data splits, parameters, dimensions, and comparisons with other algorithms. They also specify the choice of parameters, ground-truth parameters, data partitioning strategies, the likelihood model, and the number of clients and classes per client. Moreover, they discuss the performances of different configurations and provide additional results in the appendix. Overall, the authors have provided sufficient information regarding the training details.

Yes, the authors specify the training details in the experiments section of the paper. They provide information about the synthetic and real data experiments, including the data generation process, benchmark comparisons, data set sizes, data partitioning strategies, and several other parameters. In addition, they also discuss results and provide figures to compare their method with other approaches. The appendix provides more insight into the experiments with additional configurations and analysis. Overall, the authors have provided sufficient details about the training, data splits, and hyperparameters used in their experiments.
